text: Bradford is a major city in West Yorkshire, England. The city has a population of about 500,000 people. Bradford grew due to its excellence in the textile trades of nineteenth century England. Bradford is home to Bradford City Football Club who became the first English football club to win the current FA Cup trophy in 1911. Bradford is near Leeds. The two cities share the Leeds Bradford International Airport. == References == Category:1847 establishments in Europe Category:1840s establishments in England
title: Bradford
